image.altText: Man looking in a mirror and smiling.

props.synopsis: Tully Denahy's diseased teeth were ruining his life. So, like thousands of Australians, he emptied his super account to pay for new ones.

title.children: 'Wasn't a difficult choice': Tully needed more than $50,000 to pay for his new teeth, so he drained his super balance

image.altText: A smiling woman holding her smiling son in a house with a white kitchen in the background

props.synopsis: The boy's mother, Sophie Roome, and her family sent a statement to ABC News expressing their "incomprehensible grief" at the loss of their "beloved Rowan".

title.children: Mother and family express 'incomprehensible grief' after 2yo boy killed by father

image.altText: A young man wearing a cap sitting at a park table on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Young Australians are experiencing an economic crisis that shows no signs of easing — and experts fear it will cause generational inequality to worsen without substantial reform.

title.children: Young people are in economic crisis, and they're frustrated the government is 'tinkering around the edges'

image.altText: Woman in a denim jacket and floral scarf speaks into microphone

props.synopsis: Uninjured Australians have begun their return to airports across the country, following "severe turbulence" that left 18 injured and one dead on Tuesday.

title.children: 'Hard to describe in words': First plane carrying Australians on turbulent Singapore Airlines flight touches down in Sydney

image.altText: Cropped image of man's face, wearing a black cap

props.synopsis: Specialist police divers have joined the search for Geraldton man Brenton Shar, reported missing on May 10, after a pair of shorts believed to belong to Mr Shar were found in the groyne area of Midalia Beach in Beresford.

title.children: Shorts found on Geraldton beach spark renewed search effort for missing man Brenton Shar

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Police have revealed how they used data from number plate recognition cameras and a mobile phone to connect alleged Victorian High Country killer Greg Lynn to the disappearances of two campers.

title.children: Police used mobile phone data to link former pilot with missing Victorian campers, murder trial hears

image.altText: A stylised image of a partially obscured man's face with scrabble-style tiles flying towards him

props.synopsis: James Raptis, the media lawyer identified by an ABC investigation as being linked to an AI plagiarism operation, has left his position at Australian Community Media.

title.children: Media lawyer resigns after ABC investigation reveals his links to plagiarism websites

image.altText: A composite image of Spain's prime minister Pedro Sanchez, Ireland's PM Simon Harris and Norway's PM Jonas Gahr Store

props.synopsis: The three European countries will recognise an independent Palestinian state in the hopes that a two-state solution would bring peace with Israel, the respective prime ministers say.

title.children: Norway, Ireland and Spain to recognise Palestinian state, Blinken says he'll work with Congress on potential ICC sanctions

image.altText: Angus Taylor in the entrance foyer at the National Press Club.

props.synopsis: Insisting it is consistent with migration targets announced last week, Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor announces the Coalition would cut total migration by 25 per cent during its first term of government.

title.children: Shadow treasurer says Coalition would cut net migration by a quarter during first term

image.altText: Max Winchester and his wife Tiffany smile and pose together for a selfie in front of a pool.

props.synopsis: Stranded Australian tourists in riot-stricken New Caledonia say they've been notified of French government flights back to Australia, but details are unclear.

title.children: 'What a mess this place is': Australians stranded in New Caledonia desperate to get home

image.altText: A "no entry sign" blocking the entrance to a farm.

props.synopsis: Agriculture Victoria says the farm near Meredith, south of Ballarat, is in quarantine and that the variant of the disease is H7N3, the most common strain to occur in Australia.

title.children: Hundreds of thousands of chickens euthanased on Victorian farm as bird flu strain identified

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt smiles next to a door.

props.synopsis: Domestic violence comes at a great cost to victim-survivors, and it costs the nation billions. So, what can we do about it?

title.children: The financial toll of domestic violence can strip a person of their identity, so how do you rebuild it?

image.altText: A sign posted at the front of a school saying it is closed.

props.synopsis: East Kalgoorlie Primary School principal Sally Fowler says its campus is ready and staff are planning for a return date, three months after WA police discovered a backyard gold smelting operation at a neighbouring property.

title.children: WA outback school set to reopen after mercury scare

image.altText: A haunted house prop of a doll with long hair.

props.synopsis: Indonesia has one of the fastest-growing film markets in the world, and audiences can't get enough of one genre in particular.

title.children: Indonesia's film industry is on the rise and it's all thanks to the horror genre

image.altText: The interior of the Singapore Airlines plane

props.synopsis: As the world continues to burn fossil fuels, global temperatures are rising, and turbulence is just another natural phenomenon that's affected by that warming.

title.children: Planes are going to be dodging more turbulence in a warming world

image.altText: A woman with short hair looking off camera while standing next to a person

props.synopsis: South Australian doctors in general practices would be permanently exempted from paying payroll tax on earnings from bulk-billed services.

title.children: New payroll tax exemption will stop GP clinics from closing, peak medical body says

image.altText: A black and white photo of a smiling, blonde woman.

props.synopsis: A teenager who was speeding around the small West Australian town of Lancelin on an unroadworthy motorcycle when he hit and killed 53-year-old Kyla Jones is sentenced to eight months in juvenile detention.

title.children: Jail for 'hooning' teenager who hit and killed WA mother while riding unroadworthy motorcycle without lights

image.altText: Illuminated purple and white Telstra Shop signage outside Brisbane CBD store.

props.synopsis: Telstra's share price has fallen since CEO Vicki Brady made the announcement on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Analysts say Telstra's cost-cutting likely to flow through to the customer

image.altText: A herd of cows standing on a dry riverbed on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Despite a number of recent cattle rustling arrests and convictions, a rural crime expert says victims feel the justice system does not fully grasp the impact the crime has.

title.children: Expert says 'cultural gap' between victims and courts leaving rural crime underreported

image.altText: Mary Fowler holds up a Barbie doll in her likeness, wearing a soccer uniform, on her palm

props.synopsis: The Matildas star and Manchester City forward is one of nine athletes set to be honoured in a new project announced by Mattel.

title.children: Barbie to make a doll to honour Mary Fowler, gloves and bubble braid included

image.altText: Melbourne Airport

props.synopsis: A Victorian child has tested positive for H5N1 avian influenza after returning to the country from overseas earlier this year. The Department of Health says transmission to humans is rare.

title.children: First ever human case of bird flu detected in Victorian child returning to Australia

image.altText: A bus crash seen from the air. The bus has crashed through trees

props.synopsis: The driver of a bus carrying school students has died after a crash at Kilmore. The school says none of its students have been injured.

title.children: Driver dies after school bus crashes in Victorian town of Kilmore, north of Melbourne

image.altText: A woman poses softly for the camera.

props.synopsis: Sven Lindemann used six knives to stab his girlfriend in front of her young daughter, angered that she wanted to leave the relationship.

title.children: Man jailed for girlfriend's murder had 'problematic gender-based beliefs', court told

image.altText: Andrew Giles during QT

props.synopsis: A man charged over a stabbing murder in suburban Brisbane earlier this month was released by the Administrative Appeals Tribunal, despite an extensive criminal record.

title.children: Opposition questions release of immigration detainee now charged with murder

image.altText: George Clooney with a grey beard smiles off camera while his wife Amal Clooney with long brown hair smiles.

props.synopsis: Amal Clooney is arguably one of the most famous faces of human rights law. However, social media users grew frustrated in recent months by what they claimed was her silence on the Israel-Gaza war. Those critics have now been silenced.

title.children: 'Amal Clooney is nowhere to be found': How the famous lawyer silenced her critics on her Gaza stance

image.altText: Jerry being interviewed with a bandage on his bald head and glasses.

props.synopsis: Passengers detail what it was like on board the flight bound for Singapore, as a British musical theatre group identifies the 73-year-old man who died.

title.children: Terrified passengers texted 'I love you' to families during severe turbulence onboard Singapore flight

image.altText: Composite image of facial reconstruction of man and a shoe.

props.synopsis: After drawing a blank using DNA matching, police release a facial reconstruction of a man whose skeletal remains were found on a grassy hill overlooking a beach in Tasmania — with authorities saying the bones could have been there for up to 50 years.

title.children: Facial reconstruction of skeleton found with black dress shoes on farmland near Hobart released

image.altText: A split image shows a man sitting against a brick wall and two pop-art style illustrations of David Bowie and Freddie Mercury

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Brisbane-based visual artist Nordacious, AKA James Hillier, shares the lesson of "delayed gratification" that he learned from his parents and the irresistible guilty splurge in his shopping trolley most weeks.

title.children: For self-employed artist Nordacious, home ownership still feels like 'a lofty aspiration'. But this is his 'slow and steady' plan

image.altText: A close up shot of Peter Dutton in glasses.

props.synopsis: In using his budget reply to rail against foreign investors buying up existing properties, Peter Dutton almost made a case that could really help first homebuyers.

title.children: Peter Dutton has spelled out the maths on home ownership — and he might have done us a favour

image.altText: A picture of a home with a for sale sign out the front.

props.synopsis: A Queensland landlord says he has been left thousands of dollars out of pocket trying to evict renters who refused to leave after their contract was up, delaying the sale of the house.

title.children: 'I wonder if they understand the carnage': Landlord loses thousands in bid to evict tenants on expired lease

image.altText: Cluttered shelves line a wall above a bench lined with black plastic. A blender and kitchen mixer are on the bench.

props.synopsis: The government will ban compounding pharmacists from making replica versions of diabetes drugs like Ozempic and Mounjaro, widely used off-label for weight loss, amid public safety concerns.

title.children: 'Risk to public safety': Raid reveals unregulated Ozempic made in filthy conditions

image.altText: A woman and man look over finances at their laptop while sitting at a dining table.

props.synopsis: One in six women in Australia experience financial abuse. We share three ways that could increase your financial safety, including the questions you should ask a partner early in a relationship.

title.children: Questions to ask a partner that can protect you from financial abuse

image.altText: Inside the Singapore Airlines flight

props.synopsis: While weather forecasts help pilots react, experts say the turbulence experienced on the Singapore flight was unexpected and rare.

title.children: 'Exceedingly rare': Here's what we know about serious turbulence events
